required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Molecular Pathology Research Project of Glioma
clinical_study.official_title: Exploring the Feasibility of the Molecular Pathology Model of Patients With Glioma Via Retrospective Research

brief_summary.textblock: Exploring the feasibility of the molecular pathology model of patients with glioma via retrospective research.

detailed_description.textblock: Exploring the feasibility of the molecular pathology model of patients with glioma via retrospective research. This section will include 490 frozen tissue samples of patients with different grades of glioma for IDH, TERT and 1p19q mutation detection, matching blood samples, and related clinical information and follow-up information. Compare with the existing molecular pathology system, analyze the combination of IDH and TERT mutations and the feasibility of stratifying the prognosis of patients with glioma.

primary_outcome.measure: Detection the status of IDH (Isocitrate Dehydrogenase), TERT (Telomerase Reverse Transcriptase) and 1p19q (chromosome arms 1p and 19q)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: To explore the feasibility of using the mutations of IDH and TERT to replace the role of 1p19q in glioma molecular pathology

intervention.intervention_name: Detection of IDH and TERT mutation
intervention.description: Detection of IDH and TERT mutation using frozen glioma tissues

study_pop.textblock: Glioma patient from Huashan Hospital with Informed Consent Form

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Glioma
- Glioma patient with long-term follow-up data and intact clinical data
Exclusion Criteria:
- Glioma patient without Informed Consent Form
- Glioma patient without long-term follow-up data or intact clinical data
